attributes.action: Discontinue the Royal Family's exemption from the "Walter Mitty law"
attributes.background: Apparently, a law has been enforced meaning that no one can wear medals that they have not earned. However according to the Rochdale Herald, the Royal Family are exempt from this law. This is unjust and an insult to the Magna Carta which stated even the king had to obey the law.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what you're asking the UK Government or Parliament to do. The "Walter Mitty Law" (Awards for Valour [Protection] Bill) is not yet a law. You can find out more about this proposed law here: 

 http://services.parliament.uk/bills/2016-17/awardsforvalourprotection.html
